articles.title: Fear of rising interest rates sends shares tumbling in both US and Europe - The Guardian
articles.description: Comments from US treasury secretary sends tremors through already jittery financial markets
articles.content:
Fears of rising interest rates to dampen inflationary pressure as the global economy bounces back from Covid-19 has sent shares tumbling on both sides of the Atlantic.

articles.author: Naomi O’Leary
articles.title: Amazon pays no corporation tax in Europe despite €44bn sales - The Irish Times
articles.description: EU Commission will ‘continue to monitor Amazon’s behaviour’ on corporate taxation
articles.content:
Online retailer Amazon paid no corporation tax on its operations in Europe in 2020 despite enjoying record sales income of 43.8 billion, according to corporate filings seen by The Irish Times.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Oil rises on US, Europe demand growth optimism - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Brent crude futures were 65 cents, or 0.96%, higher at $68.21 a barrel at 0822 GMT, after climbing 1.2% on Monday. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures also ticked up 62 cents, or 0.1%, to $65.11 a barrel, after gaining 1.4% on Monday.
articles.content:
Oil prices rose on Tuesday after more US states eased lockdowns and the European Union sought to attract travellers, helping to offset concerns over fuel demand in India as Covid-19 cases soar.

articles.title: Big Match Feature: Man City v PSG - SuperSport
articles.description: Manchester City are well placed to reach their first European Cup final as they welcome a PSG side who, buoyed by a long run of away wins, need another memorable victory in Manchester to keep their hopes alive.
